activities: Management of human resources of the TE Connectivity Group worldwide; management of relations with existing and prospective third party vendors, customers and service providers worldwide. HR data in particular regarding existing and legacy employees including name of existing and former employee and employer, nationality of employee, date of birth, gender, history of employment, profession and education, academic titles, employee ID, marital status, salaries, payments, incentive payments and bonuses, position, department and business unit, cost center, work address, place(s) of work, date of employment, date of termination of employment/service contract, duration of employment, supervisor(s), emergency contacts including home address, social security, tax, personal workers’ insurance and retirement benefits and pays information, disabilities, performance data, data providing access to marketing materials; business travel and event booking, expense reporting, and reimbursement of travel expenses; managing payment of sales incentives and contractual obligations related to distribution of parts and services; validating receipt of IT product or service; authenticating personnel for access to the organization’s facilities and IT systems; tracking training registration and completion; project-related timekeeping; workflow management for application development, reporting, talent management, and workforce planning and analytics, verifying telephone carrier bills and apportioning internal billings to cost centers, corporate credit card data, employee stock purchase program data, email data for back-up, disaster recovery and compliance purposes, data required for compliance and surveys and investigations, data required for whistleblower hotline programs. Storing and managing information related to technical support inquiries received by call center or incident request management systems. Personal data of customers and prospective customers for the purposes of storing and managing customer/prospect information for marketing and supporting customer inquiries; ordering, manufacturing, sale, servicing, and invoicing; reporting sales for corporate reporting requirements; analysing market sales; executing marketing campaigns. Personal data of subcontractors, suppliers and third party providers in particular for the purposes of authenticating personnel, managing subcontractor relationships and compliance with corporate standards; processing and accounting of orders and returns; storing and managing customer/prospect information for marketing and supporting customer inquiries; ordering, manufacturing, servicing, sale, and invoicing; licensing, registration, and collection of taxes for sold products and services; tracking training registration and completion for subcontractor personnel; reporting sales for corporate reporting requirements. Personal data of suppliers, vendors and third party providers for the purposes of providing access to marketing materials, security policies, premises and IT systems; maintaining supplier contact information for purchasing, accounts payable, supplier technical assistance, and material and project planning; planning and maintenance of aftermarket and customization of accessory products, skill profiles, addresses (including email and telephone) of contact personnel, business related correspondence and documents including emails.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-line, off-line, manually and automatically processed, human resources and third party (vendors, supplier, subcontractor, service provider, customer) data
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
